summary:
a mod that add effects to your enchanted weapon making it look immersive AF, and lore friendly AF,
very awesome if you have many enchanted weapons with fire,etc
descriptionHtml:
[b][font=Comic Sans MS][color=#00ff00][size=4][u]Ever wished that your magic dragon-killing sword looked a bit more, well, magical? 

At the very least a sword of burning fire ought to have actual flames on it. 

In fact the Skyrim engine doesn't allow using EffectShader forms to add particles to weapons - they have to be made outside the CK and imported as NIFs - which I assume is why I've never yet seen a mod to sort this out. 

This is my shot at the problem, using what art assets I could scrounge from the existing game data.

The most common weapon enchantments are supported, but some of the effects work better than others. YMMV! 

No DLC required. Do whatever you want with this mod. but with the permission of the author![/u][/size][/color][/font][/b]

if u want to decrease the effect, go edit skyrimprefs.ini in your C:\Users\PCname\Documents\My Games\Skyrim folder , then edit this line,
[Particles]
iMaxDesired=xxx  default should be 750, can be increased for more effects.

(warning) it will also affect ingame particles like dragon fire breath, anything related to dust,smoke,snow,fx effects.

Credits to the owner of this mod : http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198056242479/
